abstract: The appointment of Douglas Peterson as the new president of Standard & Poor’s is not likely to ease investor pressure on its parent company, McGraw-Hill, to break itself up.
snippet: The appointment of Douglas Peterson as the new president of Standard & Poor’s is not likely to ease investor pressure on its parent company, McGraw-Hill, to break itself up.
lead_paragraph: The new president of Standard & Poor’s is used to dealing with crises, including mollifying angry government officials and navigating complex new regulations.

headline.main: New S.&P. Chief Knows Crisis and Change

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Credit Ratings and Credit Rating Agencies

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced

lead_paragraph: New S.&P. Chief Knows Crisis and Change | The new president of Standard & Poor’s, Douglas Peterson, is used to dealing with crises, including mollifying angry government officials and navigating complex new regulations.

abstract: But it could be hard to track down Deep Shah, the only defendant criminally charged in the government’s insider trading investigation centered on Raj Rajaratnam to have not pleaded guilty or been convicted. He is believed to be in Mumbai.
snippet: But it could be hard to track down Deep Shah, the only defendant criminally charged in the government’s insider trading investigation centered on Raj Rajaratnam to have not pleaded guilty or been convicted. He is believed to be in Mumbai.
lead_paragraph: Of the 26 defendants criminally charged in the government’s insider trading investigation centered on Raj Rajaratnam, the hedge fund billionaire, only one has not been convicted or pleaded guilty: Deep Shah.

headline.main: Fugitive Moody’s Analyst Ordered to Pay $35 Million to S.E.C.
